content: the fallen leaves scarf is a stunning accessory featuring hand-dyed yarn a fun fringe detail and the easy repeating arcade stitch for a one-of-a-kind addition to your cold-weather wardrobe with the blaze of color on the trees come the crunch and rustle of fallen leaves on the ground and i am reminded of warmth and coziness for me and memories of jumping into leaf piles in the backyard the fallen leaves scarf captures all of the beauty and nostalgia of this season this scarf is made with the arcade stitch which is simple to work in a four-row repeat that looks deceptively complicated and the finished lacy details elevate the hand-dyed yarn choice any #3/dk weight yarn can be used for this project gauge is not important for this project as long as 5 arcade stitches are worked as indicated in the instructions for row 3 to create the width of your finished scarf this pattern is written in standard us terms skill level - easy + the scarf pictured has 187 total row with 46 total 4-row repeats the featured scarf uses a us size i/9 5 5 mm crochet hook and #3/dk weight hand-dyed yarn approximately 693 yards used options city tweed dk moroccan nights yarn featured yarn details weight #3/rustic dk 85% superwash merino/15% donegal nep 231 yards/100g
